meanings.definition: The theory that all matter is composed of tiny indivisible particles called atoms.
meanings.sent1: In atomism, everything is made up of tiny particles.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study atomism to understand the building blocks of matter.
meanings.sent3: The concept of atomism can be mind-boggling at first.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts on society resembled the atomism of the physical world.
meanings.sent5: Learning about atomism can open up a whole new world of understanding.

meanings.definition: The belief in the existence of ultimate indivisible units or elements.
meanings.sent1: Ancient philosophers pondered the concept of atomism.
meanings.sent2: His strong atomism led him to seek the fundamental truths of the universe.
meanings.sent3: Some people find comfort in the simplicity of atomism.
meanings.sent4: In her mind, love was the atomism that held everything together.
meanings.sent5: The idea of atomism has sparked many debates throughout history.
